member.name: M:Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey.IsOnCurve
member.summary: Checks if this object is a valid Ed25519 PublicKey.
member.returns: Returns true if it is a valid key, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey.IsValid
member.summary: Checks if this object is a valid Solana PublicKey.
member.returns: Returns true if it is a valid key, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey.IsValid(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if a given string forms a valid PublicKey in base58.
member.remarks:
Any set of 32 bytes can constitute a valid solana public key. However, not all 32-byte public keys are valid Ed25519 public keys.
Two concrete examples:
- A user wallet key must be on the curve (otherwise a user wouldn't be able to sign transactions).
- A program derived address must NOT be on the curve.
member.param: Whether or not to validate if the public key belongs to the Ed25519 curve.
member.returns: Returns true if the input is a valid key, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey.IsValid(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if a given set of bytes forms a valid PublicKey.
member.remarks:
Any set of 32 bytes can constitute a valid solana public key. However, not all 32-byte public keys are valid Ed25519 public keys.
Two concrete examples:
- A user wallet key must be on the curve (otherwise a user wouldn't be able to sign transactions).
- A program derived address must NOT be on the curve.
member.param: Whether or not to validate if the public key belongs to the Ed25519 curve.
member.returns: Returns true if the input is a valid key, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey.IsValid(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if a given set of bytes forms a valid PublicKey.
member.remarks:
Any set of 32 bytes can constitute a valid solana public key. However, not all 32-byte public keys are valid Ed25519 public keys.
Two concrete examples:
- A user wallet key must be on the curve (otherwise a user wouldn't be able to sign transactions).
- A program derived address must NOT be on the curve.
member.param: Whether or not to validate if the public key belongs to the Ed25519 curve.
member.returns: Returns true if the input is a valid key, false otherwise.

member.name: F:Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey.ProgramDerivedAddressBytes
member.summary: The bytes of the `ProgramDerivedAddress` string.

member.name: M:Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey.TryCreateProgramAddress(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.Byte[]},Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey,Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey@)
member.summary: Derives a program address.
member.param: The derived public key, returned as inline out.
member.returns: true if it could derive the program address for the given seeds, otherwise false..
member.exception: Throws exception when one of the seeds has an invalid length.

member.name: M:Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey.TryFindProgramAddress(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Byte[]},Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey,Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey@,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Attempts to find a program address for the passed seeds and program Id.
member.param: The derived address, returned as inline out.
The bump used to derive the address, returned as inline out.
member.returns: True whenever the address for a nonce was found, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey.TryCreateWithSeed(Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey,System.String,Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey,Sol.Unity.Wallet.PublicKey@)
member.summary: Derives a new public key from an existing public key and seed
member.returns: True whenever the address was successfully created, otherwise false.
member.remarks: To fail address creation, means the created address was a PDA.

member.name: T:Sol.Unity.Wallet.SeedMode
member.summary:
Specifies the available seed modes for key generation.
Available modes:

member.name: F:Sol.Unity.Wallet.SeedMode.Ed25519Bip32
member.summary: Generates Ed25519 based BIP32 keys. This seed mode is compatible with the keys generated in the Sollet/SPL Token Wallet, it does not use a passphrase to harden the mnemonic seed.

member.name: F:Sol.Unity.Wallet.SeedMode.Bip39
member.summary: Generates BIP39 keys. This seed mode is compatible with the keys generated in the solana-keygen cli, it uses a passphrase to harden the mnemonic seed.
